vision.notes: Given that this family is likely subterranean, vision may be reduced or absent. Further research is needed.

chemoreception.notes: Crustaceans generally rely on chemoreception for finding food and mates in aquatic environments. Likely present in this family as well.

mechanoreception.notes: Crustaceans use mechanoreceptors for detecting water currents, vibrations, and tactile stimuli. Likely crucial for navigation and prey detection in the absence of light.
